bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Carl Reeve (1900-1980), a son, along with Harold Ware, of Ella Reeve Bloor (1862-1951) was a Communist, the chair of the Washington State CP, at one time served on the Central Committee of the CPUSA, was Educational Director of Party's Eastern Pennsylvania organization, and was in 1940 a Communist candiate for Senator from Pennsylvania. He wrote The Life and Times of Daniel De Leon (1972) and with his wife Ann Barton Reeve, James Connolly and the United States: The Road to the Irish Rebellion (1978).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains research materials, notes and reviews pertaining to James Connolly and the United States, correspondence of Ann and Carl Reeve, manuscripts my Ann and Carl Reeve, including a review essay by the latter "Under Which Flage: A Play by James Connolly," two small Irish nationalist posters, one memorializing Connolly, the other in Gaelic, a file on the Transport Workers Union of America, Local 100 (New York City), and a fragile copy of the Sinn Fein Rebellion Handbook: Easter, 1916, compiled and published by the Weekly Irish Times of Dublin, Ireland.
